definition: to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]

sentences.english: But US stock markets tumbled along with oil and gold.
sentences.chinese: 而美国股市及石油和黄金期货价格却集体暴跌。

sentences.english: The current vegetable price slump has taken its toll on Chinese farmers.
sentences.chinese: 近日蔬菜价格暴跌使广大的中国菜农损失惨重。

sentences.english: And the gut-wrenching crash in European equities has reversed itself a bit in recent days.
sentences.chinese: 而且欧洲股市惨痛暴跌的情况近来也渐渐好转。

sentences.english: How about in 2002, when markets were in free-fall?
A further collapse in prices could be forestalled by unexpected supply disruptions.
sentences.chinese: 意料之外的供应中断可能会阻止价格的进一步暴跌。

sentences.english: If the bubble bursts, land prices could plummet, leaving the banks dangerously exposed.
sentences.chinese: 假如泡沫破裂，地价可能暴跌，银行将暴露于危险中。

sentences.english: Experienced when the boom collapsed, many customers choose wait and see.
sentences.chinese: 在经历暴涨暴跌时，许多客户选择观望。

sentences.english: Mr. Slocomb blamed the government's handling of the economy for the stock market's woes.
sentences.chinese: 斯洛克姆将股市的暴跌归咎于政府处理经济的做法。

sentences.english: The Dow lost 508 points in a single day.
Share plummet or plunge on the news of the devaluation.
sentences.chinese: 壹友贬值的消息，菏票价格就暴跌了。

sentences.english: Haitong Securities fell out of the sharp fall in a number of what?
sentences.chinese: 海通证券下跌的暴跌了在若干什么？

sentences.english: Why did the value of Salomon Brothers dropso dramatically?
sentences.chinese: 为什么所罗门兄弟公司的价值如此剧烈地暴跌？

sentences.english: He has dealt reasonably well with the housing-market slump.
sentences.chinese: 他在住宅市场暴跌中应对的相当好。

sentences.english: The price of electronic products slump recently.
sentences.chinese: 最近以来，电子产品的价格暴跌。

sentences.english: We've seen market interest rates - which were in danger of spiralling - actually fall.
sentences.chinese: 我们看到处于暴跌险境的利率确实下跌。

sentences.english: In Spain and Ireland boom also seems to be turning into bust.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙和爱尔兰的繁荣也似乎正在转入暴跌。

definition: to fall back (of water level or share prices)
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
